questions.question: Why does Mr. Hooper's sudden adoption of a black veil make his congregation uneasy?

choices.answer: They think he means them harm
They have no explanation
It reminds them of his sinfulness
They think he's had a terrible accident

questions.question: After the end of the first service on the first Sunday Mr. Hooper wears the veil what happens?

choices.answer: No one wants to walk beside him or invite him to dinner.
They all quickly adjust to his appearance.
Two of the children start to laugh at the strange sight.
Mr. Hooper goes directly home instead of greeting people.

questions.question: After permanently adopting the black veil, what does Mr. Hooper do?

choices.answer: He ignores his responsibilities as a minister.
He frequently weeps and flies into a rage.
He accuses his congregation of terrible sins.
He tends to his congregations with his usual care.

questions.question: Who are the only people who call for Mr. Hooper's assistance?

choices.answer: little children
the family of a young woman who has died
people who are facing imminent death
the family of Hooper's fiancee

questions.question: What happens when Mr. Hooper says all people must be prepared for their veils to be removed?

choices.answer: the corpse is heard to make a sound.
the parishioners finally understand the meaning of the veil.
no one fully understands what he means.
he astonishes everyone by removing his veil.

questions.question: The reader can understand what from Elizabeth's talk with Mr. Hooper?

choices.answer: Mr. Hooper is doomed to be lonely.
Mr. Hooper wants to call off the engagement.
Elizabeth understands why Mr. Hooper wears the veil.
Elizabeth rejects him only because she's worried of scandal.
aged
young and fresh
a new word
old-fashioned, not "current"
a musical instrument
something that stands on its own & represents something else
it's always a flag
something people do

questions.question: According to Mr. Hooper, the veil is a symbol of what?

choices.answer: How people are reluctant to see the world clearly
How people hide their innermost selves
How people are constantly aware of death's approach
How people try to alter their physical appearance

questions.question: Why does Mr. Hooper choose his symbolic act of looking physically different from others?

choices.answer: to reveal how he is more sinful than other people
to protect him from other people's sin
to highlight his role as an agent of holiness
to represent him as a prisoner of something shared by all.

questions.question: What is another word for "outward appearance"?

choices.answer: semblance
resolute
obscure
iniquity

questions.question: What is a word for "thinking deeply or seriously"?

choices.answer: antipathy
iniquity
obscurity
pensively

questions.question: What is a word for "something hidden or concealed"?

choices.answer: antipathy
obscurity
sagacious
pensive
plausability
sagaciousness
ostentatious
portendability

questions.question: Why does Nathaniel Hawthorne make Mr. Hooper a minister,not a banker, a teacher, or a merchant?

choices.answer: a minister might not be suspected of having inner secrets
ministers might be more thoughtful and realize his condition
Mr. Hooper is not a minister
as a spiritual leader, a minister might carry more authority
